title: Staff of the dead

properties.value: The staff of the dead is a bladed staff that requires 75 Magic and 75 Attack to wield. It is dropped by K'ril Tsutsaroth, and counts as a Zamorakian item while in the God Wars Dungeon and in the desert Bandit camp. It is one of the few items that boosts the player's magic damage, boosting it by 15%.

Item ID11791

The staff of the dead is a bladed staff that requires 75 Magic and 75 Attack to wield. It is dropped by K'ril Tsutsaroth, and counts as a Zamorakian item while in the God Wars Dungeon and in the desert Bandit camp. It is one of the few items that boosts the player's magic damage, boosting it by 15%.

When a combat spell is cast with the staff, there is a 1/7 (~14.2%) chance that the staff will negate the rune cost for that spell. The staff can be substituted for a slayer's staff for casting Magic Dart (and is more accurate than a Slayer's staff), and can autocast Flames of Zamorak, Crumble Undead, Magic Dart, and Arceuus combat spells.

Being a bladed staff, it is notable for its offensive melee stats, which are unusually high for a Magic weapon. Its stats surpass that of a dragon scimitar by a strength bonus of 6 and a slash bonus of 3 while possessing the same attack speed.

The staff of the dead offers an attack speed of 4 when using melee, which is the same as weapons such as the abyssal whip. However, when using magic spells, it offers an attack speed of 5, which is the same as all spells, except for spells cast by powered staves or the harmonised nightmare staff.

Special attack[edit | edit source]

A player using the staff of the dead's special attack, Power of Death.

The staff has a special attack, Power of Death, that halves all of the opponent's melee damage, consuming 100% of the player's special attack energy. Upon activating the special attack, a message will appear in the player's chatbox: "Spirits of deceased evildoers offer you their protection."

The effect lasts for one minute after using the special attack, but is immediately lost if players unequip the staff. Re-equipping the staff before taking damage from another source will still reduce incoming damage until the effect runs out. In addition, the effect stacks with the PvP damage reduction effect of the Protect from Melee prayer. The effect does not stack with itself should the player manage to cast the effect more than once before the initial cast expires.

The special attack cannot be used in the Duel Arena if magic is disabled.

Upgrading[edit | edit source]

Players with level 59 Crafting can attach a magic fang to the staff using a chisel, creating a toxic staff of the dead. This enhances its magic attack bonus by +8, and has the ability to infect a target with venom. However, taking advantage of these benefits requires using Zulrah's scales to charge the staff. Targets can only be infected with venom while using a magic attack, but using both melee and magic attacks will consume Zulrah's scales.

Alternatively, players can use Saradomin's light on the staff of the dead to create the staff of light, which inherits the effects of the staff of the dead. This process is irreversible. The only differences between the two staves is that the staff of light is able to autocast Saradomin Strike instead of Flames of Zamorak, is unable to cast Arceuus combat spells, and it counts as both a Zamorakian and a Saradominist item while in the God Wars Dungeon and in the Desert Bandit Camp.

Players can bring a Staff of the dead and Guthixian icon to Juna to upgrade it to the staff of balance. This process is irreversible. The only differences between the two staves is that the staff of balance is able to autocast Claws of Guthix instead of Flames of Zamorak, and it counts as both a Zamorakian and a Guthixian item while in the God Wars Dungeon and in the Desert Bandit Camp.

Development history[edit | edit source]

In response to player requests for a magic weapon with the same functionality as the 2010 version of the staff of light from RuneScape, the weapon was offered as a new reward from K'ril Tsutsaroth in a Developer's Blog offering the God Wars Dungeon. The weapon passed the poll with 78% of the supporting votes.

Though the weapon had passed the poll, it had not been given a name or design yet. Another Developer's Blog was released two weeks after the poll ended, giving players insight on the technical limitations that the team had in terms of graphics, such as being unable to take models from RuneScape to use for a staff of light model, and only being able to use six colours for item models. With the limitations in mind, the team then offered six designs for the weapon:

  • Staff of light: A recoloured Rod of Ivandis.

  • Staff of darkness: A recoloured Rod of Ivandis in the colours of Zamorak.

  • Staff of wrath: Uses the anger spear from the quest A Soul's Bane as the design.

  • Staff of the dead: Uses the staff Necrovarus wields as the design.

  • Staff of the damned: A recoloured Ahrim's staff in the colours of Zamorak.

  • Wand of darkness: Uses the infused wand from the quest What Lies Below as the design.

The designs were then polled; the design with the most votes was Necrovarus' staff of the dead (25.6%). The other designs, in order of popularity, were:

  • Staff of Darkness (22.5%)
  • Staff of Light (19.7%)
  • Staff of Wrath (13.2%)
  • Wand of Darkness (9.9%)
  • Staff of the Damned (9.1%)

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
8 January 2015
(update)

Toxic Staff of the Dead, a lvl 75 Attack/Magic Bladed Staff has been added to the game by adding a Magic Fang onto it.

21 November 2013
(update)

The Staff of the Dead's special attack code was occasionally reading a bit of memory that hadn't been initialised; this could potentially have caused the special attack to malfunction. This is now fixed.

7 November 2013
(update | poll)
  • The special attack - blocking some of the melee damage you take - is now counted as a Magic attack. In places like the Duel Arena, if the combat rules would forbid Magic, the player will equally be unable to use this special attack.
  • Can now be used to auto-cast Flames of Zamorak

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Necrovarus appears to wield the staff.
  • The Staff of the dead is one of four unique boss drops that are not dropped by the respective bodyguards (excluding hilts), the others being steam battlestaff, Saradomin's light and Armadyl crossbow.

[[File:Staff of the dead detail.png|left|200x175px]]
The '''staff of the dead''' is a [[bladed staff]] that requires 75 [[Magic]] and 75 [[Attack]] to wield. It is dropped by [[K'ril Tsutsaroth]], and counts as a [[god item|Zamorakian item]] while in the [[God Wars Dungeon]] and in the desert [[Bandit Camp (Kharidian Desert)|Bandit camp]]. It is one of the few items that boosts the player's magic damage, boosting it by 15%.

When a combat spell is cast with the staff, there is a 1/7 (~14.2%) chance that the staff will negate the rune cost for that spell. The staff can be substituted for a [[slayer's staff]] for casting [[Magic Dart]] (and is more accurate than a Slayer's staff), and can [[autocast]] [[Flames of Zamorak]], [[Crumble Undead]], [[Magic Dart]], and [[Arceuus spellbook#Combat spells|Arceuus combat spells]].

Being a bladed staff, it is notable for its offensive melee stats, which are unusually high for a Magic weapon. Its stats surpass that of a [[dragon scimitar]] by a strength bonus of 6 and a slash bonus of 3 while possessing the same attack speed.

The staff of the dead offers an attack speed of 4 when using melee, which is the same as weapons such as the [[abyssal whip]]. However, when using magic spells, it offers an attack speed of 5, which is the same as all spells, except for spells cast by [[powered staves]] or the [[harmonised nightmare staff]].

==Combat styles==
{{CombatStyles|Bladed Staff}}

==Special attack==
[[File:Power of Death.gif|thumb|170px|A player using the staff of the dead's special attack, ''Power of Death''.]]
The staff has a [[special attack]], ''Power of Death'', that halves all of the opponent's [[melee]] damage, consuming 100% of the player's special attack energy. Upon activating the special attack, a message will appear in the player's chatbox: "''{{Colour|#007f00|Spirits of deceased evildoers offer you their protection.}}''"

The effect lasts for one minute after using the special attack, but is immediately lost if players unequip the staff. Re-equipping the staff before taking damage from another source will still reduce incoming damage until the effect runs out. In addition, the effect stacks with the PvP damage reduction effect of the [[Protect from Melee]] [[prayer]]. The effect '''does not''' stack with itself should the player manage to cast the effect more than once before the initial cast expires.

The special attack '''cannot''' be used in the [[Duel Arena]] if magic is disabled.

==Upgrading==
Players with level 59 [[Crafting]] can attach a [[magic fang]] to the staff using a [[chisel]], creating a [[toxic staff of the dead]]. This enhances its magic attack bonus by +8, and has the ability to infect a target with [[venom]]. However, taking advantage of these benefits requires using [[Zulrah's scales]] to charge the staff. Targets can only be infected with [[venom]] while using a magic attack, but using both melee and magic attacks will consume [[Zulrah's scales]].

Alternatively, players can use [[Saradomin's light]] on the staff of the dead to create the [[staff of light]], which inherits the effects of the staff of the dead. This process is '''irreversible'''. The only differences between the two staves is that the staff of light is able to autocast [[Saradomin Strike]] instead of [[Flames of Zamorak]], is '''unable''' to cast [[Arceuus_spellbook#Combat_spells|Arceuus combat spells]], and it counts as both a Zamorakian and a Saradominist item while in the [[God Wars Dungeon]] and in the [[Bandit Camp (Kharidian Desert)|Desert Bandit Camp]].

Players can bring a Staff of the dead and [[Guthixian icon]] to [[Juna]] to upgrade it to the [[staff of balance]]. This process is '''irreversible'''. The only differences between the two staves is that the staff of balance is able to autocast [[Claws of Guthix]] instead of [[Flames of Zamorak]], and it counts as both a Zamorakian and a Guthixian item while in the [[God Wars Dungeon]] and in the [[Bandit Camp (Kharidian Desert)|Desert Bandit Camp]].

==Development history==
In response to player requests for a magic weapon with the same functionality as the 2010 version of the {{RSL|staff of light}} from ''RuneScape'', the weapon was offered as a new reward from [[K'ril Tsutsaroth]] in a [[Update:Dev blog: Poll 9, featuring Godwars|Developer's Blog]] offering the [[God Wars Dungeon]]. The weapon passed the [[Poll:Old School feature poll 9: God Wars & Banks|poll]] with 78% of the supporting votes.

Though the weapon had passed the poll, it had not been given a name or design yet. Another [[Update:K'ril's Magic Weapon|Developer's Blog]] was released two weeks after the poll ended, giving players insight on the technical limitations that the team had in terms of graphics, such as being unable to take models from ''RuneScape'' to use for a staff of light model, and only being able to use six colours for item models. With the limitations in mind, the team then offered six designs for the weapon:

<gallery mode="packed" heights="150">
K'ril's Magic Weapon (2).png|'''Staff of light''': A recoloured [[Rod of Ivandis]].
K'ril's Magic Weapon (3).png|'''Staff of darkness''': A recoloured Rod of Ivandis in the colours of [[Zamorak]].
K'ril's Magic Weapon (4).png|'''Staff of wrath''': Uses the [[anger spear]] from the quest [[A Soul's Bane]] as the design.
K'ril's Magic Weapon (5).png|'''Staff of the dead''': Uses the staff [[Necrovarus]] wields as the design.
K'ril's Magic Weapon (6).png|'''Staff of the damned''': A recoloured [[Ahrim's staff]] in the colours of [[Zamorak]].
K'ril's Magic Weapon (7).png|'''Wand of darkness''': Uses the [[infused wand]] from the quest [[What Lies Below]] as the design.
</gallery>

The designs were then [[Poll:Kril's Magic Weapon|polled]]; the design with the most votes was Necrovarus' staff of the dead (25.6%). The other designs, in order of popularity, were:
* Staff of Darkness (22.5%)
* Staff of Light (19.7%)
* Staff of Wrath (13.2%)
* Wand of Darkness (9.9%)
* Staff of the Damned (9.1%)

==Changes==
{{Subject changes header}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 8 January 2015
|update = Zulrah - The Solo Snake Boss
|change = Toxic Staff of the Dead, a lvl 75 Attack/Magic Bladed Staff has been added to the game by adding a Magic Fang onto it.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 21 November 2013
|update = Clan Cup Trophy & fixes
|change = The Staff of the Dead's special attack code was occasionally reading a bit of memory that hadn't been initialised; this could potentially have caused the special attack to malfunction. This is now fixed.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 7 November 2013
|update = POH updates & weapon tweaks
|poll = Old School feature poll 12: Player-designed content
|change = 
*The [[special attack]] - blocking some of the melee damage you take - is now counted as a [[Magic]] attack. In places like the [[Duel Arena]], if the combat rules would forbid [[Magic]], the player will equally be unable to use this [[special attack]].
*Can now be used to auto-cast [[Flames of Zamorak]]
}}
{{Subject changes footer}}

==Trivia==
*[[Necrovarus]] appears to wield the staff.
*The Staff of the dead is one of four unique boss drops that are not dropped by the respective bodyguards (excluding hilts), the others being [[steam battlestaff]], [[Saradomin's light]] and [[Armadyl crossbow]].
